wiki.content: The Right Place, Wrong Time Songfacts says: Lyrically, "Right Place, Wrong Time" is standard blues fare, documenting in ironic one-liners the singer's propensity for misfortune. In the tune's weirder moments, Rebennack fuses this blues-based sense of the absurd with a psychedelic sensibility in line with the late '60s mood that saw Dr. John's emergence. He calls, for instance, for a little "brain salad surgery" to fix his ailing mind, articulated here as "refried confusion." User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: The Right Place, Wrong Time Songfacts says: Lyrically, "Right Place, Wrong Time" is standard blues fare, documenting in ironic one-liners the singer's propensity for misfortune. In the tune's weirder moments, Rebennack fuses this blues-based sense of the absurd with a psychedelic sensibility in line with the late '60s mood that saw Dr. John's emergence. He calls, for instance, for a little "brain salad surgery" to fix his ailing mind, articulated here as "refried confusion."

comments: not the same version that is on the album.I wish last fm would be more factual.Anyway Dr. john is killer

This is a different production from the actual CD - not as right there real performance.
Great song and I love the Docta BUT I'm not liking the tone of whatever piano/keyboard he is using here.

got into DJ after watching the Scorcese rockumentary on The Band about 8 years ago.  Fantactic work..!!!!
So nice to really hear how the piano and Dr.John make more than enough of a funk!
Could this be the best dance song ever?
